result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamichael Daniel Dean

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court via Zoom.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Calendar Call. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel advises the court he has been unsuccessful in contacting client.
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to Commissioner and no action on bail.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel recently appointed and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamichael Daniel Dean in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lamichael Daniel Dean
Current: 3410 W Lisbon Ave #204, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 05-04-2022)
Prior: 1615 South 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/04/2022@2:30pm
